{ "step_by_step_thinking": "The midface is the central region of the face, including the area from the eyes to the upper lip. The glabella is the space between the eyebrows and above the nose. The subnasale is the point where the bottom of the nose meets the upper lip. Therefore, the midface is defined as the portion between the glabella and the subnasale.", "answer_choice": "B" }
